pullRequest.body:
co-authored by: @jjaassoonn 
splited from [#23216](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23216) following @eric-wieser advice

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f4b9b3ac62](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23320/commits/f4b9b3ac6243a995e9da955fef3c1ac5b0161dce)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.TwoSidedIdeal.SpanAsSum` (new file)|1249|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ mem_span_ideal_iff_exists_fin`
`+ mem_span_iff_exists_fin`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This would be closer to `Finsupp.mem_span_iff_linearCombination` if we wrote it as
```suggestion
    ∃ l : ↑s →₀ (R × R), l.sum (fun yi lri => lri.1 * yi * lr.2) = x
```
assuming this is true!

Here's an outline to get you started:
```lean
lemma mem_span_range_iff_exists_finsupp (v : ι → R) (x : R) :
    x ∈ span (Set.range v) ↔ ∃ l : ι →₀ (R × R), l.sum (fun i lri => lri.1 * v i * lri.2) = x := by
  constructor
  · intro h
    sorry
  · rintro ⟨l, rfl⟩
    exact finsetSum_mem _ _ _ fun i _ ↦ mul_mem_right _ _ _ (mul_mem_left _ _ _ <| subset_span <| Set.mem_range_self _)

lemma mem_span_iff_exists_finsupp (s : Set R) (x : R) :
    x ∈ span s ↔ ∃ l : ↑s →₀ (R × R), l.sum (fun yi lri => lri.1 * yi * lri.2) = x := by
  rw [ ← mem_span_range_iff, Subtype.range_coe_subtype, Set.setOf_mem_eq]
```
I would guess the missing piece is actually `TwoSidedIdeal.span_induction`
sure but before I start golfing my proof, why is `finsupp`better than `finset.sum`?
or should we keep both versions?

> sure but before I start golfing my proof, why is `finsupp` better than `finset.sum`?

Mainly my objection is that `∃ (ι : Type) (_ : Fintype ι) ` is usually pretty annoying to work with.

It is possible that my theorem above is false, since sums of the form $$axb + cxd$$ can't be represented...
I'll try to work with it but I think it's okay to keep both?

the problem now is to prove `mem` as in : if `r ∈ Set.range v`, prove `r` is in the form of this sum, the proof is obviously using (1, 1) when v i = r and 0 elsewhere, but a counterexample is when v maps everything to r and ι is an infinite set

That shouldn't be allowed, since we're talking about a Finsupp.


Either way, I think my comment above about $l_1xr_1 + l_2xr_2$ which can't be factored into a single term of the form $lxr$ dooms this approach; I think perhaps better to express this using `Multiset.sum` instead? So the existential would quantify over a term of type `Multiset (R × ι × R)`.
how do I set this up? I've never worked with `Multiset` before :((

```
lemma mem_span_range_iff_exists_finset_sum (v : ι → R) (x : R) :
    x ∈ span (Set.range v) ↔ ∃ l : Finset (R × ι × R), (l.sum fun | (l, i, r) => l * v i * r)= x := by
```

Even `Finset (R × ι × R)` looks like a nightmare, because you can't use $$l_1xr_1+l_2xr_2$$ until you've checked that either $$l_1\not=l_2$$ or $$r_1\not=r_2$$, or that they are both equal, in which case you then need to replace $$l_1$$ by $$2l_1$$.
If you really want to go down this route then maybe the thing to do is to prove that if you are a Multiset.sum then you are a Finset.sum by manipulating the sets, but this doesn't sound very natural.

```suggestion
`∑ i, rᵢ * sᵢ * tᵢ` where `rᵢ, tᵢ ∈ R, sᵢ ∈ s` .
```
I think this is less confusing.
A subset of what? And the span as a what?

pullRequest.title: feat(Mathlib/RingTheory/TwoSidedIdeal/SpanAsSum): span of set as finsum
